title: Data Analysis
overview: This section helps you make sense of cleaned data by finding patterns, trends, and key figures. Analysing data is vital for making informed decisions and forms a major part of Assessment Method 1 for the Data Technician (ST0795) apprenticeship.

skills: Use sorting and filtering to explore data
Calculate totals, averages, and counts using SUM, AVERAGE, COUNT
Apply simple conditional formatting to highlight values
levels.task: Use basic formulas to calculate the average and total amount from the cleaned sales data. Use filtering to view entries by region.

skills: Use COUNTIF, AVERAGEIF, and SUMIF to analyse subsets of data
Group and summarise using pivot tables
Find outliers using filters and conditional formatting
levels.task: Create a pivot table to summarise total sales by region. Use COUNTIF to identify how many entries exceed £200.

skills: Build dynamic pivot tables and slicers
Create calculated fields within pivot tables
Use advanced formulas like XLOOKUP or nested IFs
levels.task: Create a pivot chart that updates with a slicer for region. Use XLOOKUP to find the corresponding customer name for an ID entered in a separate cell.

dataSource.name: Synthetic training dataset
dataSource.note: This fictional dataset is a cleaned version of the Section 2 file, created for practising analysis techniques.
